alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Morgan; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:54PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morgan, northwestern Johnson, southeastern Rowan, central Wolfe and Elliott Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1253 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leisure, or 8 miles north of West Liberty, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fannin Valley, Farley, Wagner Store, Elliottville and Vale around 100 PM EST. Sandy Hook, Stark and Newfoundland around 105 PM EST. Bruin around 110 PM EST. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 50 and 59. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 143 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for southeastern, northeastern and east central Kentucky.
